name: premonitory
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
warning about something unpleasant before it happens: premonitory sign Premonitory signs of the coming revolution can be seen across the previous decades.premonitory symptom The patient died suddenly, without any premonitory symptoms, while working in his garden.
More examplesFewer examplesWith hindsight, the title of her second novel seems premonitory.She plays an illustrator of children's books who has premonitory dreams of children being kidnapped.We are given a premonitory hint of the events that are about to take place.
